channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Weinstein Accuser Tells Her Story of Coerced Sex for a Second Time
item.description: Miriam Haley, one of three women who prosecutors say were victims of Harvey Weinstein, testified at his retrial in Manhattan.

item.title: Corporation for Public Broadcasting Sues White House to Block Board Firings
item.description: The media organization said the White House emailed three of the company’s five directors on Monday, telling them that their positions had been termin...

item.title: Major food brands will stop using artificial dyes. Here’s why RFK is sounding the alarm
item.description: A series of studies have raised concerns by associating synthetic food colorings with health risks from hyperactivity to cancer.

item.title: A Lawmaker Blasted a Hospital’s Super Bowl Ad. Then He Changed His Tune.
item.description: NYU Langone Health aired a commercial showcasing its doctors during the Super Bowl. A North Carolina congressman wondered if it was a waste of money.

item.title: Humanitarian aid for Africa is drying up. It’s hard but I see an opportunity to build something better
item.description: African ingenuity must step forward in this sobering moment—and we’re already scaling local solutions.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg reveals the morning routine that’s ‘better than caffeine’
item.description: Mark Zuckerberg reveals his morning routine—and how he recovers from looking at his phone.

item.title: Stock market retreat in Trump’s first 100 days is among worst starts for a president in almost a century
item.description: In President Joe Biden’s first 100 days, the S&P 500 surged more than 9%. Under Trump, it’s tanked almost 8%.

item.title: Supreme Court Considers Suit Over F.B.I.’s Raid of the Wrong House
item.description: The legal questions were tangled, but some justices seemed incredulous at a government lawyer’s defense of a botched operation involving a battering r...

item.title: Trump’s first 100 days in office have cost Elon Musk $113 billion of his net worth
item.description: The Tesla CEO has lost 25% of his wealth as he nears the end of his tenure as a “special government employee.”

item.title: Trump to Sign Executive Order Walking Back Some Auto Tariffs
item.description: Most levies on imported cars and car parts will remain in place, but automakers have secured some relaxation of the trade policy.

item.title: Felling of Sycamore Gap Tree Was ‘Deliberate and Mindless,’ Prosecutor Says
item.description: The trial for two men accused of cutting down the 200-year-old Hadrian’s Wall tree opened Tuesday in northeastern England. Both pleaded not guilty.

item.title: Mosque Killing Puts French View of Muslims Under Scrutiny
item.description: The victim was stabbed dozens of times last Friday while he was praying, and critics say officials were slow to call it a bias crime or show concern.

item.title: Mellon Foundation Announces $15 Million for Humanities Councils
item.description: The emergency funding came after the National Endowment for the Humanities canceled most existing grants, part of a pivot toward President Trump’s pri...

item.title: U.K. Crossbow Attack Suspect Voiced Racist and Misogynist Views
item.description: The British police said a man accused of an attack on the weekend in Leeds died from a self-inflicted injury. Investigators are reviewing two Facebook...

item.title: Sectarian Clashes Erupt in Syria, Killing 9
item.description: The sectarian-tinged violence was directed at a suburb of the Syrian capital with a large population from the Druse minority. Local Druse leaders said...
